Hi i love the new iva stuff and the new model/textures. Btw how would you feel about using or just referencing a normalmap in the unity config. The capsule would look even better than now with some normal map details i think. This would also save me the time of doing this myself every time the model gets updated:P

Here is the pod with a carbon fiber normalmap i made for the chaka monkey Project over a placeholder diffuse map some time ago to show what kind of details is possible to achieve

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This map itself is only 512x512px so it almost dont add any extra memory usage

heh nice, though that small engine fits inside the top tank, no need for the orange radials

M-SE, MODC-2, Galaxy VR-2, EX SAT1 all fit inside that hollow cylinder in the TOE tank, it's up-side-down by default with the side with the hole facing up, turn it around.

Thanks, egreSS , and thanks to everyone who helps and supports me doing this mod
meanwhile, I finally started to make out manual
Holy smokes this is amazing. Alex, you're one talented guy

http://youtu.be/-yLGm32LYV0

OMFG Did you just were able to animate it or did Mihara helping you, supposing it is coming in RPM....

OMFG Did you just were able to animate it or did Mihara helping you, supposing it is coming in RPM....

Yes, it's some tricky using of the RPM animation features.

The "InternalSeat" GameObject is linked with model of seat and the animation of this model is performed by the RPM module

Awesomesauce, would be so nice if we at some point could actually move around in IVA, go through docking ports and into other vessels etc, I know there is that set of pretty wonky hollow parts but that just lets you EVA inside vessels.
Step by step the pod becomes a masterpiece Kudos!

Btw not sure if it's a bug or not but I think the buttons for the 3 interior lights are backwards, they're lit up when the lights are off, while the 3 external light buttons are the reverse, they light up when the lights are on.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Btw not sure if it's a bug or not but I think the buttons for the 3 interior lights are backwards, they're lit up when the lights are off, while the 3 external light buttons are the reverse, they light up when the lights are on.

nope, that is not a bug, i have do that specially. wanna light buttons gotta be loud looking in the dark

Edited February 21, 2014 by alexustas

yeah, that is quite logical. Finding light buttons in the dark is hard when you can not see them. Meanwhile, the outside light will be off most of the time, so it makes sense to light them up when the lights are on.

http://youtu.be/-yLGm32LYV0

Did you just...

Makes logical sense but for me it feels backwards and inconsistent to have one the other way around, disregard my OCD.

Btw what about the interior lights showing through the windows? B9 style:

All 3 windows would be cool, possibly the hatch's window? And the top window should respect the blinds open/closed, no idea how much work that would be obviously, would be a neat addition if it's not a lot of work.

Btw made a drop-pod out of the ALCOR using 2 stretchable conic tanks to "shroud" the bottom and make it drop-pod shaped and a Mk1-2 pod's heat shield from DRE:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Quite happy with it, my mainstay shuttle design, use it to ferry kerbals to and from orbit.
